title: Magnetic force - bar moving on rails in field

content.question: A metal bar of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is pushed to the right at a constant speed along two horizontal, parallel, conducting rails, as shown in the top view diagram. The rails are separated by a distance <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>ℓ</mo></math>, and are connected at the left end by a wire. The rails and wire have negligible resistance. The entire apparatus is in a uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> that is directed into the page. At time <math alttext="t sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> the bar is at position <math alttext="x sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>, and a short time later at time <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> the bar is at position <math alttext="x sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the average force exerted on the bar by the magnetic field between <math alttext="t sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator l times B, and denominator R, end fraction, times the fraction with numerator x sub f, end sub, minus x sub i, and denominator t sub f, end sub, minus t sub i, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mo>ℓ</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator l squared times B squared, and denominator R, end fraction, times the fraction with numerator x sub f, end sub, minus x sub i, and denominator t sub f, end sub, minus t sub i, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mo>ℓ</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator x sub i, end sub, times B, and denominator R, end fraction, times the fraction with numerator x sub f, end sub, minus x sub i, and denominator t sub f, end sub, minus t sub i, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi>B</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator x sub i, end sub, times l, times B squared, and denominator R, end fraction, times the fraction with numerator x sub f, end sub, minus x sub i, and denominator t sub f, end sub, minus t sub i, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>ℓ</mo><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
